tag_professor: LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Professor Nahmias uses the same pdf notes every year, even in different classes. During class, he just scrolls through the pdf on the projector and reads off of it. Sometimes he tries to get the class to participate by asking students to do problems on the board, but nobody know how to do it, so he ends up telling them what to write anyway

comments: The material of the class is hard to understand. If you spend time to slowly go over his pdf files you will sure understand the course. He also curve the class so it\'s relatively easy to get a B, but extremely hard to get an A

tag_professor: LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Professor Nahmias is very disrespectful. He laughs at students every signal lecture for students\' lacking of perfect American accent, lack of full knowledge of this course, and so on. The thing is if we are perfect, we don\'t have to sit in his class! A very discouraging professor!

tag_professor: LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Easy subject, if you attend classes and work on assignments then easily you can secure a good grade.

tag_professor: LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Nahmias is an interesting guy and tells some funny stories. At times, he can be a bit condescending, which is why I hesitated to ask questions. Work load is reasonable, but spend a lot of time on the homework because it\'s graded problem by problem. Can get a decent grade with some effort, but a lot more work to get an A.

tag_professor: LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Quite Tricky. Secretive about his material. Class problems are much easier than HW problems. HW is graded. Requires a lot of hardwork. But Midterms and finals were easy. Go for it. Secured an A easily ;).

tag_professor: LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: I have never been very much interested in this kind of subjects. Overall I think the class can be organized better if the material was provided with a better formatting instead of hand-written notes scanned as pdf. Not particularly bad but I will not be missing this class

tag_professor: LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: There\'s a midterm and final (40/60). Prof is old school,dry sense of humor, decent for a dry subject. Tricky tests tho. Class average on midterm was 64%. I usually get A\'s or A-\'s, but found studying for this exam tough. Not a lot to cover, but he does try to trip you up on questions. Overall he\'s okay.

comments: Not helpful, likes to trick students, gave sample final exam to study - none of the sample questions were at all similar to the final.

tag_professor: LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: I honestly don\'t think he knows that he truly doesn\'t add value to his students but takes away the very thing they have come to learn.

tag_professor: LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Not interested in actually teaching. Does not like answering questions. Makes fun of students\' accents.

tag_professor: LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Lectured materials not reflective of homework and tests. Review sessions: waste time on some "clicker" exercises rather than reviewing homework problems. Does not respond to emails. Provide solutions late. Did all homework (9+/10), attended all classes and got a B-. I\'m an honor student.

tag_professor: LECTURE HEAVY (2)  Tough Grader (2)  GRADED BY FEW THINGS (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Nahmias is one of those guys you wouldn\'t mind inviting over for afternoon tea. He\'s pleasant and humorous, and uses humor to break the tension during the more difficult to understand concepts. Very knowledgeable, and presents the material in a straightforward manner. If you do (and understand) the homework, you\'ll do fine on the exams.
